reviewText:
Thank you MPRM for sending us this DVD to review!

Shelby is a beagle that has lived in a dog pound for as long as he can remember.  He has a habit of escaping at every opportunity, and Doug the dog catcher (played by Tom Arnold) catches him every time.  Just when Shelby was about to be generously adopted by a rich mother and her spoiled son, Shelby manages to escape once again.

Instead of running home free, Shelby gets hit by a truck and is taken in by the man who hit him since the vets office was closed for Christmas.  The wife cant stand dogs, but she doesnt get to meet Shelby as he slips out of the truck and into their basement as soon and the husband pulls into their driveway.  Their son, Jake finds Shelby and takes a liking to him and names him after his favorite magician, P. T. Shelby.  Jake bonds to Shelby right away since he doesnt have any human friends.

Between Shelby and Jakes uncles dog who is also uninvited, things get pretty hairy around Christmas dinner. Doug the dog-catcher comes by looking for Shelby and sneaks a peek of Jakes mom changing her shirt after wine got spilled on it.  Besides the relatively tame peep show, there is plenty of potty humor involving laxatives and breaking the law to take stuff that is not legally yours.  In the end there is one good lesson taught, and that is to never beat an animal under any circumstance.  There are some warm and fuzzy moments at the end about Christmas being all about family and togetherness.  Thats all fine and good but I still prefer Jesus to be front and center during our Christmas celebration.

In the end, Shelby was an okay movie.  My kids seemed to enjoy it and the flatulence humor within.  Its ninety-two minutes long and goes for $20 on Amazon.  I would recommend renting it first.
My Madison loved it...
Excellent Movie!!! Chevy Chase is back!!
Really cute story!  My granddaughter watches it over and over.  Tom Arnold plays a good role and does it well but, poor ole' Chevy Chase doesn't act like he feels well.
GOOD FAMILY MOVIE
Great family movie.
An enjoyable Christmas fantasy.  Shelby's a dog you'll love.
My kids loved it.  Chrstmas, dog, Chevy Chase... Can't go wrong!

This was such a fun movie! Both my boys, ages 5 & 8 both enjoyed this movie. My five-year old enjoyed it so much that he requested to watch it again the next day. Highly recommend if you are looking for a fun family holiday movie with a few laughs.

**We received a copy of this DVD in exchange for our honest opinion**
I was expecting a heart warming Christmas story. In my opinion this was not that.

I had to turn off the movie when the mother declared "Oh my God".  Too bad.  My kids were sad.

I wish producers would be more sensitive to those that take the 10 commandments seriously.  Namely, the commandment "Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy God in vain". https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thou_shalt_not_take_the_name_of_the_Lord_thy_God_in_vain
its a good movie made me cry
Cheese on a stick, but when your child is named Shelby, you have to have it.
Everything was great.
Kids loved this movie!
enjoyed this movie... good for family viewing.

Seventy-percent of the reviewers LOVED this Christmas movie. The rest were spread, evenly, between 1; 2; 3; and 4-star ratings.
What a magical cast of FAMILIAR faces! Chevy Chase, Tom Arnold, Rob Schneider, John Paul Ruttan. Chevy Chase! Where has he
been; Maryland?
This was, practically, a Christmas present from Amazon. Com. I put it in my shopping basket with a roll of WHITE---and BLACK---
Gorilla-brand "hundred-mile-an-hour duct-tape". The next day "SHELBY:..." was more than half-off! ~ ~ ~ Merry Christmas! ~ ~ ~
A great movie---certainly better than "SANTA'S BOOT CAMP"---for the family. Gee! Cannot get enough of Bill Murray or Chevy Chase.
Only way this could've been better is if also had a GROUNDHOG!
This is a good movie with a wonderful cast.  Some of the other reviews didn't really give it justice and I enjoyed it very much.
A holiday fun movie my nephew enjoyed alot!
Five Stars
I love animals movies. Great for family viewing, especially for children. Loved this movie.
